quiz.text: Which of the following set represents communicable diseases?
options: Anaemia, Scurvy, Diarrhoea, Cholera
Typhoid, Malaria, Anaemia, Swine flu
Typhoid, Swine flu, Malaria, Polio
Diabetes, Typhoid, Malaria, Anaemia
All Of the above

options: Central List
State List
Concurrent  LIst
All of the above
Residuary list

Pradhan Mantri Shishu Vikas Yojana
Pradhan Mantri Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
Pradhan Mantri Balika Suraksha Yojana

options: 2014
2002
2010
2017
2009

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements:
  1. National Health Authority's (NHA) primary activity is to manage the Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana. 
  2. NHA is governed by a Governing Board chaired by the Directorate General of Health Services, Ministry of Health & Family Welfare. 
Which of the given above statements is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text: As per Health Policy, 2017 approved by the Union Cabinet recently, what was the expected amount of public health expenditure as a percentage of GDP?
options: 5.5%
4.5%
3.5%
2.5%
2.8 %

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the targets of National Health policy 2017.
  1. Increase health expenditure of Government from the existing 1.15% to 2.8% of the GDP by 2025.
  2. Increase Life Expectancy at birth from 67.5 to 70 by 2025.
  3. Reduction of Total Fertility Rate (TFR) to 2.1 at national and sub-national level by 2025. In FY 2016, India had TFR at 2.3 birth per woman.
Which of the above statements are correct ?
options: Only 1
Only 2 and 3
Only 1 and 2
Only 3
All of the above

quiz.text: What does the infant mortality rate refer to?
options: The ratio of the number of children who die before their fifth birthday out of every 1000 live births.
The ratio of the number of children who die before their first birthday out of every 1000 live births.
The ratio of the number of children who die before their fifth birthday out of every 100 live births.
The ratio of the number of children who die before their first birthday out of every 100 live births.
The ratio of the number of children who die before their first birthday out of every 5000 live births.

quiz.text:

  1. This Yojana provides free health insurance of Rs. 5 lakh per person. 
  2. The expenses incurred in this Scheme (Yojana) is shared between the Centre and State in 60:40 ratio. 
Select the correct answer from the codes given below.
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text:
Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA) is Government of India's flagship programme for achievement of Universalization of Elementary Education (UEE) in a time bound manner, as mandated by 86th amendment to the Constitution of India making free and compulsory Education to the Children of 6-14 years age group, a Fundamental Right.

SSA is being implemented in partnership with State Governments to cover the entire country and address the needs of 192 million children in 1.1 million habitations. The programme seeks to open new schools in those habitations which do not have schooling facilities and strengthen existing school infrastructure through the provision of additional classrooms, toilets, drinking water, maintenance grant and school improvement grants.

Existing schools with inadequate teacher strength are provided with additional teachers, while the capacity of existing teachers is being strengthened by extensive training, grants for developing teaching-learning materials and strengthening of the academic support structure at a cluster, block and district level. SSA seeks to provide quality elementary education including life skills. SSA has a special focus on girls' education and children with special needs. SSA also seeks to provide computer education to bridge the digital divide.

Q. Which among the following statement is incorrect regarding Sarva Siksha Abhiyan (SSA)?

  1. It was launched in 2001.
  2. The World Bank in association with the Ministry of HRD developed a portal called "Shagun" that was launched to regulate and monitor the SSA programme.
  3. Padhe Bharat Badhe Bharat is a sub-program of the Sarva Siksha Abhiyan.
  4. It is implemented in partnership with State Governments.
options: Only 2 and 4
Only 1 and 3
Only 2
Only 3
None of the above

quiz.text:

SSA is being implemented in partnership with State Governments to cover the entire country and address the needs of 192 million children in 1.1 million habitations. The programme seeks to open new schools in those habitations which do not have schooling facilities and strengthen existing school infrastructure through provision of additional class rooms, toilets, drinking water, maintenance grant and school improvement grants.

Existing schools with inadequate teacher strength are provided with additional teachers, while the capacity of existing teachers is being strengthened by extensive training, grants for developing teaching-learning materials and strengthening of the academic support structure at a cluster, block and district level. SSA seeks to provide quality elementary education including life skills. SSA has a special focus on girl's education and children with special needs. SSA also seeks to provide computer education to bridge the digital divide.

Q. Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan is aimed to provide elementary education
options: To all children of below poverty line families.
To all persons in the age group of six to fifty five years.
To girl child of tribal areas.
To all children in the age group of six to fourteen years.
None of the above

Q. National Programme for Education of Girls at Elementary Level (NPEGEL) is an amendment to:
options: The scheme of Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA)
The scheme of Rashtriya Madhyamik Siksha Abhiyan (RMSA)
The scheme of District Primary Education Programme (DPEP)
The scheme of National Policy of Education (NPE)
None of the above

quiz.text:

Q. The National Mission of SSA includes which of the following bodies? 

  1. The Governing Council
  2. The Executive Committee 
  3. The Project Approval Board
options: Only 1
Only 2 and 3
Only 3
Only 1 and 2
All of the above

quiz.text:
The Prime Ministers Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nutrition or POSHAN Abhiyaan or National Nutrition Mission, is Government of Indias flagship programme to improve nutritional outcomes for children, pregnant women and lactating mothers. Launched by the Prime Minister on the occasion of the International Womens Day on 8 March, 2018 from Jhunjhunu in Rajasthan, the POSHAN (Prime Ministers Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nutrition) Abhiyaan directs the attention of the country towards the problem of malnutrition and address it in a mission-mode.

NITI Aayog has played a critical role in shaping the POSHAN Abhiyaan. The National Nutrition Strategy, released by NITI Aayog in September, 2017 presented a micro analysis of the problems persisting within this area and chalked out an in-depth strategy for course correction. Most of the recommendations presented in the Strategy document have been subsumed within the design of the POSHAN Abhiyaan and now that the Abhiyaan is launched, NITI Aayog has been entrusted with the task of closely monitoring the POSHAN Abhiyaan and undertaking periodic evaluations.

Q. Which of the following are the objectives of 'National Nutrition Mission'?

  1. To create awareness relating to malnutrition among pregnant women and lactating mothers. 
  2. To reduce the incidence of anaemia among young children, adolescent girls, and women. 
  3. To promote the consumption of millets, coarse cereals, and unpolished rice. 
  4. To promote the consumption of poultry eggs. 

Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 and 2 only
1, 2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 4 only
3 and 4 only
1 and 3 Only

quiz.text:

Q. Consider the following statements about Poshan Abhiyan/National Nutrition Mission.

  1. It is a multi-ministerial mission.
  2. Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched it.
  3. It only focuses on malnutrition in children.
  4. It is expected to double the stunting by 2022

Which of the following statements are correct ?
options: Only 1 and 4
Only 2 and 3
Only 1 and 2
All of the above
1, 2 and 3

Q. Who among the following is the beneficiary of the POSHAN Abhiyan/National Nutrition Mission?

  1. Children
  2. Lactating Mothers
  3. Pregnant Women
  4. Widow Women
options: Only 1 and 2
Only 3 and 4
Only 2 and 3
Only 1,2 and 3
All of the above

Q. Which among the following is not among the four-pillar strategy that the program has been built upon ?
options: Inter-sectoral convergence for better service delivery
Use of technology for real-time growth monitoring and tracking
Intensified health and nutrition services for the first 1000 days
Jan Andolan (Peoples movement)
Making India disease free by 2030

quiz.text: A postpartum period extends for how many weeks after delivery?
options: 5 years
6 days
6 hours
6 weeks
6 Months
